snippet: Mitt Romney was less likely on his overseas trip to offer criticisms about “European entitlement society” than conciliatory words.
abstract: Political Memo; presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney has been using criticisms of Europe as standard part of his stump speech, but takes pains to tone down his language during his seven-day trip there; Romney instead offers conciliatory words celebrating centuries of European-American alliances.

byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish contributed reporting from Berlin, and Michael Barbaro from New York.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney was less likely on his overseas trip to offer criticisms about “European entitlement society” than conciliatory words.

headline.seo: Romney, in Europe, Tones Down Anti-European Comments
headline.main: A Different Continent, a Different Tune
headline.print_headline: A Different Continent, a Different Tune
